737.3.text: Instead of being hidden, a card with Hidden may be played for its cost as normal, at its normal timing with no restrictions on targeting.

737.4.text: Multiple instances of Hidden are redundant.

737.5.text: Hidden, and whether or not a card has Hidden, is a characteristic of the card and may be checked or referenced by other Game Effects.

737.5.a.text: This is independent of the state of being facedown.

737.6.text: A card that is Hidden gains Reaction while facedown, and may be played any time a card with Reaction may be played as a result.

737.6.a.text: The property is granted to the card in its facedown state, and is not publicly known.

738.1.a.text: It can be present on Spells, Units, Rune Abilities, Legend Abilities and Permanent Abilities.

738.1.c.text: Starting from the Keyword to the end of the clause, the entire statement is the Legion Ability.

738.1.c.1.text: On spells and on play effects of permanents, it is functionally short for “If you have played another Main Deck card before this one already this turn, apply [Text].”

738.1.c.2.text: On other abilities and instructions, it is functionally short for “If you have played a Main Deck card this turn, apply [Text].”

738.1.c.3.text: This is called the Legion condition.

738.1.c.4.text: Legion's conditional can apply to passive abilities, activated abilities, spell instructions, or even abilities active in zones outside of the board.

738.2.text: All instances of Legion on cards a player controls are satisﬁed by that player playing a single card.

738.3.text: Legion, and whether or not a card has Legion, is a characteristic of the card and may be checked or referenced by other Game Effects.

739.1.a.text:
It can be present on Spells, Units, Rune Abilities, Legend Abilities and Permanent
Abilities.

739.1.b.text: Reaction grants the corresponding card or effect all abilities and permissions of Action.

739.1.c.text: Reaction , additionally, is functionally short for the following:

739.1.c.1.text: On Spells: "This can be played during Closed States on any player's turn."

739.1.c.2.text: On Units: "This can be played during Closed States on any player's turn."

739.1.c.3.text: On Rune, Legend, or Permanent Abilities: "This can be activated during Closed States on any player's turn."

739.2.text: The corresponding card or effect with this keyword is not restricted to Closed States or Showdowns . This permission is inclusive of all other timings and options available to the ability as written, Action's permissions, or by default.

739.3.text: Reaction does not alter the function of any instruction of the Card, Rune, or Effect it is on. It is only Permission.

739.3.a.text: Playing Units with Reaction still has the inherent restrictions of playing Units without Reaction. It can only be played to the controlling player's base or a battleﬁeld they control.

739.4.a.text: Whether or not a Game Object has Reaction is a characteristic of that Game Object and may be checked or referenced by other Game Effects.

739.4.b.text: Whether or not a Spell has Reaction is a characteristic of that Spell and may be checked or referenced by other Game Effects.

739.4.c.text: Whether or not an Ability has Reaction is a characteristic of that Ability and may be checked or referenced by other Game Effects.

740.1.text: Shield is a Passive Ability keyword.

740.1.b.1.text: The X is referenced in the functional text of the ability.

740.1.b.2.text: The X is referred to as the Shield Value.

740.1.b.3.text: If X is omitted, it is presumed to be 1.

740.1.c.text: It is functionally short for "While I am a defender, I have +X [M]."

740.1.d.text: Being a defender means the Unit has gained the Defender designation during Combat. See rule 437. Combat for more information.

740.1.d.1.text: Shield remains in effect as long as the Unit maintains the Defender designation.

740.2.text: If a Unit has Shield, or has been granted Shield, and is granted Shield by an additional source, the Shield Value of all granted Shield keywords is summed.

740.3.text: Shield, and whether or not a unit has Shield, is a characteristic of the Unit and may be checked or referenced by other Game Effects.

741.1.text: Tank is a Passive Ability keyword.

741.1.b.text: It is functionally short for "I must be assigned lethal damage before any other unit with the same controller as me that does not have [Tank] during combat resolution."

741.1.c.text: It alters how players can elect to assign combat damage during combat.

741.1.c.1.text: Players must still assign lethal damage to a unit before moving to the next when assigning their damage.

741.1.c.2.text: If more than one unit with Tank is present with the same controller in Combat, damage may be assigned to any of them. Units without Tank are invalid assignments until all units with Tank have lethal damage assigned to them.

741.2.text: Multiple instances of Tank are redundant.

741.3.text: Tank, and whether or not a unit has Tank, is a characteristic of the Unit and may be checked or referenced by other Game Effects.

742.1.text: Temporary is a Triggered Ability keyword.

742.1.b.text: It is functionally short for "At the start of this permanent's controller's Beginning Phase, before scoring, kill this."

742.1.c.text: The Trigger Condition is the controller of the permanent's Beginning Phase occurring.

742.2.text: Multiple instances of Temporary are redundant.

742.3.text: Temporary, and whether or not a permanent has Temporary, is a characteristic of the permanent and may be checked or referenced by other Game Effects.

743.1.text: Vision is a Triggered Ability keyword.

743.1.b.text: It is functionally short for "When this is played, look at the top card of your Main Deck. You may recycle it."

743.1.c.text: The trigger is the permanent entering the Board.

743.2.text: Multiple instances of Vision trigger separately.

743.2.a.text: The player may choose to recycle or not recycle for each instance of Vision separately.

743.2.b.text: If the player does not recycle the top card and nothing else happens in between the triggers resolving, each instance of Vision will see the same card.

743.3.text: Vision, and whether or not a permanent has Vision, is a characteristic of the permanent and may be checked or referenced by other Game Effects.

744.1.text: Equip is an Activated Ability keyword.

744.1.a.text: Equip is normally present on Gear with the tag Equipment.

744.1.b.text: Equip has a cost to activate and Attaches the card with Equip to a chosen Unit when the cost is paid.

744.1.b.2.text: The chosen Unit will become the Top-Most Card for the Attach action.

744.1.c.1.text: If paying costs or making choices for this ability causes triggered abilities to trigger, they will be placed on the chain above this ability in a Pending state. See rule 369 Activated Abilities for more information.

744.1.c.2.text: Equip is functionally short for “[Cost]: Attach this gear to a unit you control.”

744.1.c.3.text: Equip costs may include both resource costs and non-resource costs.

744.1.c.4.text:
Equip abilities may also include text that alters the Equip cost. Such text is taken
into
account
when
determining
a
card’s
Equip
cost
for
any
reason.

744.1.c.5.text: Equip abilities may include text that alters the timing or targeting of the Equip ability.

744.2.text: When the Attach action completes from this keyword, the Unit that was chosen is considered to have been Equipped by the Gear with this ability.

744.2.a.text: This is an event other Game Effects and Triggered Abilities can reference.

744.3.text: Equipped is the state of a Top-Most Card being Attached by one or more cards that are Equipment.

744.3.a.text: The state of being Equipped is synchronous with that of the Attached state of the Equipment.

744.3.b.text: A Top-Most Card is Equipped as long as one or more of its Attached cards are Equipment.

744.3.c.text: The state of being Equipped corresponds to a Top-Most card having a card with Equip that is Attached to it.

744.4.text: Multiple instances of Equip are equivalent to multiple Activated Abilities and can each be activated separately by paying the corresponding costs.

744.5.text: Whether or not a Gear has Equip may be referenced even if the Rules Text of the Gear is Inactive. See rule 716 Attachment for more information.

745.1.text: Quick-Draw is a Triggered Ability keyword. It is also a Permissive keyword.

745.1.a.text: Quick-Draw is present on Gear with Equip abilities.

745.1.b.text: Cards with Quick-Draw have Reaction inherently.

745.1.c.text: Quick-Draw allows cards to be played and Attached using Reaction timing.

745.1.d.text: Quick-Draw is functionally short for “ [Reaction] ” and “When you play this, attach it to a Unit you control.” See rule 716 Attachment for more information.

745.2.text: Multiple instances of Quick-Draw do not trigger separately and have no effect beyond the ﬁrst.

745.3.text: Quick-Draw has no function while on the board.

745.4.text: Quick-Draw , and whether or not a gear has Quick-Draw , is a characteristic of the Gear and may be checked or referenced by other Game Effects.

746.1.text: Repeat is an Optional Additional Cost keyword.

746.1.b.text: Repeat is an optional cost that player may pay to execute the effect of their spells a second time.

746.1.c.1.text: The Cost is an Additional Cost to be paid during the steps of playing the spell.

746.1.c.2.text: If a spell has more than one instance of Repeat , each Cost may be paid or not paid individually.

746.1.c.3.text: Each Repeat Cost can be paid only a single time.

746.1.d.text: Repeat is functionally short for “You may pay [Cost] as an additional cost as you play this spell. If you do, execute the instructions of this spell one additional time.”

746.1.d.1.text: When the additional cost is paid, the effect of the spell, upon resolution, will be performed an additional time.

746.2.text: When a spell’s effect is performed an additional time with Repeat , choices must be made at the usual time during the Make Relevant Choices step of Playing a Card. See rule 346 Playing Cards for more information.

746.2.a.text: Choices made for the additional execution do not have to be the same as the choices made for the initial execution.

746.3.text: Multiple instances of Repeat can be paid for separately. The spell’s instructions will be executed an additional time for each instance of Repeat that is paid for.

746.3.a.text: Regardless of the number of times a spell's instructions are executed with this keyword, the spell is only Played once.

746.4.text: Repeat , and whether or not a spell has Repeat , is a characteristic of the Spell and may be checked or referenced by other Game Effects.

747.text: 4 Weaponmaster , and whether or not a unit has Weaponmaster , is a characteristic of the Unit and may be checked or referenced by other Game Effects.

747.1.text: Weaponmaster is a Triggered Ability keyword.

747.1.b.text: Weaponmaster is a Play Effect that chooses an Equipment you control and allows you to pay its Equip cost at a discount, regardless of the usual timing of the Equip ability, to Attach that Equipment to the unit with Weaponmaster.

747.1.c.text: Weaponmaster is functionally short for: “When you play me, choose a Card you control with the Equipment tag. Necessary portions of its Rules Text are no longer Inactive if they are currently Inactive. Pay the cost of its Equip ability, reduced by [A], to attach it to this unit.” See rule 716 Attachment for more information.

747.1.c.1.text: Weaponmaster can choose an Equipment whether it has an Equip ability or not.

747.1.c.2.text: The cost of the Equip ability is determined as though that Equip ability was being activated choosing the unit with the Weaponmaster ability, as modulated by any abilities that alter Equip costs.

747.1.c.3.text: If the chosen card’s Equip cost does not contain [A], it can still be paid, but will not be reduced.

747.1.c.4.text: If the chosen card doesn’t have an Equip cost, it can’t be paid.

747.1.c.5.text: If the chosen card’s Equip cost can’t be paid, if it can’t be detached from its current Top-Most card, or if it can’t be attached to the unit with the Weaponmaster ability, it stays in its current location, Attached to anything it was already Attached to.

747.1.c.6.text: The Equip ability is not activated this way, and the unit with the Weaponmaster ability is not chosen.

747.2.text: Multiple instances of Weaponmaster trigger separately, and can choose different targets.

747.2.a.text: If you choose the same target with multiple instances of Weaponmaster , each will resolve separately.

747.3.text: Weaponmaster has no function while on the board.
